entry.title: Metaplanet Buys Another ¬•500 Million Worth of Bitcoin
entry.summary:
Metaplanet, a publicly listed Japanese investment firm, purchased an additional ¬•500 million ($3.4 million) worth of bitcoin. This brings the company's total Bitcoin holdings to 303, acquired for ¬•2.95 billion ($20 million).
JUST IN: üáØüáµ Metaplanet buys another ¬•500 million worth of #Bitcoin pic.twitter.com/dfGWwqNBXw ‚Äî Bitcoin Magazine (@BitcoinMagazine) August 13, 2024
On August 6th, Metaplanet announced plans to raise ¬•10.08 billion through a stock rights offering to expand its Bitcoin reserves. It followed on August 8th with a ¬•1 billion loan secured to buy more Bitcoin. The firm has aggressively pursued a Bitcoin accumulation strategy this year to strengthen its balance sheet. Metaplanet believes Bitcoin can appreciate significantly and hedge against yen depreciation. The latest ¬•500 million bitcoin buy was for 57.1 BTC at an average price of ¬•8.8 million per bitcoin. Metaplanet's total 303 Bitcoin were acquired for ¬•9.7 million per Bitcoin on average. The company is taking a page from MicroStrategy's playbook, aggressively using debt and equity to grow its Bitcoin stash. Metaplanet stock has been significantly up since first announcing its Bitcoin pivot in April, despite recently falling from year-highs. The company is positioning itself as a publicly traded proxy for Bitcoin exposure in Japan. Other firms like MicroStrategy, Marathon Digital Holdings, and Semler Scientific are also raising money in debt markets to buy more Bitcoin and ride its adoption curve. These savvy public companies are using the fiat system's cheap lending rates to accumulate scarce Bitcoin. Disclaimer: Bitcoin Magazine is wholly owned by BTC Inc., which also operates UTXO Management, a regulated capital allocator focused on the digital assets industry and invested in Metaplanet. UTXO invests in a variety of Bitcoin businesses, and maintains significant holdings in digital assets.

entry.title: El Salvador Seals $1.6 Billion Deal To Modernize Ports And Bring Bitcoin City To Life
entry.summary:
El Salvador is making headlines anew as it embarks on a landmark investment to revamp its port infrastructure, paving the way for the ambitious vision of its Bitcoin City.
Yilport Holdings, owned by a Turkish company, invested a whopping $1.6 billion for the renovation and modernization of two such ports: Acajutla and La Uni√≥n. This is undoubtedly the largest private money ever poured in the history of the country, and as such is expected to trigger further economic growth in this country.
El Salvador: Major Investment For Developing The Ports
The announcement was revealed via social media by President Nayib Bukele. He explained that an investment of more than $1.615 billion would be made by Yilport Holdings in the upgrading of the Pacific Port of La Uni√≥n and in modernizing Acajut‚Ä¶

entry.title: $53 Billion In USDT & USDC Entering Exchanges Daily Now: Why This Is Bullish For Bitcoin
entry.summary:
Data shows the exchange inflows of Tether (USDT) and USD Coin (USDC) have spiked recently. Here‚Äôs why this could be relevant for Bitcoin.
Stablecoins Are Observing Higher Than Usual Inflows Right Now
As explained by CryptoQuant author Axel Adler Jr in a new post on X, the monthly average exchange inflow of the top two stablecoins, USDT and USDC, has gone up recently.
The ‚Äúexchange inflow‚Äù here refers to an on-chain indicator that keeps track of the total amount of a given asset being deposited into the wallets associated with centralized exchanges.
When the value of this metric is high, it means the exchanges are receiving a large amount of deposits right now. Such a trend suggests there is demand among the holders to trade away cryptocurrency.
On the other hand, the low indica‚Ä¶

entry.title: Binance.US Faces Setback as Appeals Court Validates HEX Token Manipulation
entry.summary: A United States appeals court has partially overturned a previous dismissal of a class-action lawsuit against Binance.US. The lawsuit accuses the cryptocurrency exchange of unlawfully manipulating the price of the HEX token. A panel of three judges from the Ninth Circuit ruled on August 12 that the plaintiff, Ryan Cox, had presented valid claims against Binance.US and CoinMarketCap. The panel disagreed with a district court‚Äôs earlier dismissal, which had found that Cox failed to establish a sufficient connection between specific actions in Arizona and Binance.US. Appeals Court Upholds Claims Cox initially filed the class-action lawsuit in 2021. He alleged that Binance Capital Management and Binance.US had artificially restricted the HEX token‚Äôs ranking on CoinMarketCap. C‚Ä¶

entry.title: $365 Million Crypto Scam: South Korean CEO Indicted For Alleged Fraud
entry.summary:
South Korean authorities have arrested and indicted the CEO of a tech firm and his accomplice for fraud. The two men are suspected of orchestrating a crypto scheme of over 500 billion won that took advantage of elderly people with false promises of massive returns. The scam is estimated to have over 10,000 members and has affected hundreds of victims.
Crypto Ponzi Scheme Targets Elderly People
Last month, the CEO of tech firm Wacon, Byun Young-oh, and Vice Chairman Yim Mo-Soo were arrested for allegedly orchestrating a crypto scheme worth hundreds of billions of won. entry.title: Here‚Äôs Why The Rapid Decline In The Ethereum Fees Could Be A Problem
entry.summary:
The Ethereum gas fees for transactions have dropped massively amidst a broader decline in the cryptocurrency‚Äôs price. According to recent data, the base fee paid by users has fallen to an astonishingly low 0.82 Gwei, a clear indication of reduced activity on the Ethereum network.
Rapid Decline In Ethereum Base Fees
Data from Ultra Sound Money reveals that Ethereum‚Äôs base gas fee experienced a continuous decline throughout last week, eventually hitting a multi-year low of 0.82 Gwei on Saturday, August 11. This significant drop in gas fees can be attributed to a decrease in large transactions on the Ethereum network. On-chain data from IntoTheBlock indicates a sharp fall in the number of transactions greater than $100,000, with numbers dropping from 16,990 transactions on Monday to just ‚Ä¶

Jump Trading continues to liquidate holdings. Ethena founder confirms protocol has ‚Äòzero issues‚Äô. Binance launches native KAS mining. Cycle hasn‚Äôt even started yet: Cobie.

entry.title: Mog: The 4Chan Meme Now Worth $800 MILLION
entry.summary: Mogging started on 4Chan back in 2016 as a slang term to dominate another person. But now, eight years later, mog has redefined itself through an Ethereum meme coin. Crypto traders Aug and Slumpt often joked that they‚Äôd launch a cryptocurrency around the mogging meme but never really pulled through. That was until Aug decided to press the button.

entry.title: Fomo Hour 171 - The Bitcoin Bounce
entry.summary: BTC ETFs: +51m, ETH ETFs: +$26m. BTC bounces at $62k amid $300m liquidations. BTC volatility hits 2 month high. SOL flips ETH monthly DEX volume. SOL rumour claims insiders own 8%. Coinbase shares rise 2% after strong earnings. Marathon Digital falls 8% after revenue miss. Bybit exits France over regulation. Crypto(.)com surpasses Coinbase volume. Do Kwon will be extradited to South Korea. CVG falls 99% after exploit. JUP votes to reduce 30% team supply.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 170 - BITCOIN FALLS BELOW 65K
entry.summary: BTC ETFs: +0m, ETH ETFs: -$77m. Crypto falls after Fed, Trump speech & Iran threats. Mt. Gox still has $2.1bn BTC after distributions. Lummis introduces bill to buy 1m BTC. Large BTC holders bought $5.4bn in July. Tether makes $1.3bn profit in Q2. DeFi loans hit 2022 levels. Base sees 80% of active Uniswap traders. $900m of altcoin unlocks this month. Elixir launches deUSD as rival to Ethena.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 169 - NEIRO HITS $100M!
entry.summary: BTC ETFs: -$18m, ETH ETFs: +$34m. Mt. Gox move another $3bn BTC, prices stable. ETH ETFs see net inflow as Grayscale outflow slows. BTC exchange reserves hit multi-year low. XRP up 7% ahead of potential SEC settlement. UAE banks integrate crypto trading. Bybit integrates USDe with up to 20% yield. California DMV puts 42m car titles on AVAX. BTC mining to be a $20bn industry: Bernstein. Russia legalises various crypto activities. Terra blockchain halted, Astro faces $6.8m exploit. Trump raised $21m at BTC conference.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 168 - SEC DROPS SOL CLAIMS
entry.summary: BTC falls to $66k after government moves $2bn BTC. Transfer most likely just a new custodian. SEC plans to drop charges SOL is a security. SOL ETF not happening in near term: BlackRock. ETFs to hit model portfolios later this year: BlackRock. Grayscale ETH ETF outflows slow marginally. Tron surpasses ETH & SOL for 24hr revenue. Pump(.)fun revenue beats ETH. BTC future tied to the elections: Jeffries. Polymarket hits $1bn betting volume. Polymarket integrates with Substack. Binance Labs announce 7th season of incubations. There is merit to Bitcoin and other coins: Elon. DeFi coins rise as MKR votes to share fees. COMP agrees to share fees with token holders.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 167 - CHATTING TO DOODLES!
entry.summary: BTC nears $70k after Trump speech, PoW alts soar. Crypto funds saw $245m inflows last week. Open Interest on BTC hits record $39.4bn. SOL overtakes ETH in several key metrics. Pump(.)fun overtakes ETH for daily revenue. Jito overtakes Lido for fees collected. $1.5bn altcoin unlocks in August, $600m XRP. Compound DAO faces $25m governance attack. JUP vote to reduce supply 30% is this week. JUP vote to reduce supply 30% is this week.

entry.title: New Technology Is Making Bionic Limbs More Affordable
entry.summary: Alt Bionics founder and CEO Ryan Saavedra talks with Decrypt's Jason Nelson about the Genesis Hand, an affordable $5,000 bionic limb designed for daily use.

entry.title: The Story of Solana Meme Coin Billy
entry.summary: Billy is the largest Solana meme coin on Pumpdotfun, peaking at a market cap of over $200 million. But it wasn‚Äôt always smooth sailing. Minutes after launching Billy‚Äôs dev abandoned him and sold the majority of their tokens. At the time, the tokens were worth $1,116 but at today‚Äôs value they‚Äôd be worth more than $8.65 million.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 166 - CRYPTO AND STOCKS FALL
entry.summary: BTC ETFs: +$44m, ETH ETFs: -$133m. ETH falls as Grayscale ETF outflows continue. ETH ETFs still see $1bn of daily volume. Liquidations hit $250m in sell-off. ETH Open Interest hits ATH at CME. BTC whales have bought $23bn in July. SOL weekly active addresses hits ATH. Bitstamp to distribute Mt. Gox BTC today. Russia to legalise crypto mining & payments. Lummis set to introduce BTC strategic reserve bill. Harris will not be at Bitcoin Nashville. BTC going to $52m by 2050: VanEck. Hashdex file for mixed BTC & ETH ETF. Coinbase to make tokenised treasuries fund. Polymarket partners with Moonpay for on-ramp. Ferrari accepts crypto in Europe. Bitfarms stopped in poison-pill strategy. Riot buys another miner for $93m.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 165 - ETH ETFs TAKE IN 107M
entry.summary: BTC ETFs: -$78m, ETH ETFs: +$107m. BTC falls amid ETF outflows & Mt. Gox movements. ETH ETFs see ‚Äòvery solid‚Äô first day $107m inflows. Grayscale ETH trust sees $484m outflow. ETH ETF volumes come out at 23% of BTC. Debate about whether strong flows will continue. SOL DEX volume continues to rise above ETH. Harris may also speak at Bitcoin Nashville. Harris could be far more open to Bitcoin: Cuban. BTC symbol lights up Vegas Sphere. Coinbase continues to pursue Gensler emails. dYdX explores sale of derivatives tech. dYdX site recovers after DNS attack. JD to create Hong Kong stablecoin. Bitwise uses ENS addresses for ETH ETFs. BlackRock applies for ENA cash allocation. Uber CEO wants to accept BTC.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 164 - ETH ETF DAY!
entry.summary: BTC ETF Flows: +$534m. ETH outperforms slightly as 9 ETFs set to launch. Grayscale moves $1bn ETH to Coinbase for outflows. Biggest BlackRock ETF inflow day in 4 months. Mt Gox moves $2.8bn BTC for distributions. US government moves $4m BTC to Coinbase. Bedford FC buys $4.5m BTC. Hamilton Lane launches private credit fund on SOL. CNBC discusses BTC reserve currency rumour. Polymarket sets another trading record. BlockFi administrator submits plan to repay customers. WLD denies insider trading and manipulation claims. India keeps high crypto taxes unchanged. Gate exchange exits Japan. Marathon Digital fined $138m for breaching NDA. HyperLend launches lending on HyperLiquid.

entry.title: Mika Shares How to Sell Crypto Using Kraken Wallet
entry.summary: Rug Radio creator Mika guides you through the process of selling crypto and transferring it back to your bank account.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 163 - JOEVER FOR BYEDEN
entry.summary: Crypto dips then bounces on Biden-Harris switch. SOL again leads, DEX volume eclipses ETH + BNB. Biden news had led to $67m liquidations. Democrats have chance to ‚Äòregain crypto vote‚Äô. Mt Gox transfers to Bitstamp expected soon. Crypto sees $3.2bn fund inflows in 3 weeks. China company Boyaa buys $100m BTC. Polymarket saw $80m bets on Biden withdrawal. Polymarket 2024 volumes hit $500m. Elon appearance at Bitcoin Nashville rumoured. Combined SOL, BTC & ETH ETF coming: Geraci. Call skew heads to 2024 extremes in bullish sign. Plan B points to bullish setup in S2F model. Coinbase premium moves back to positive. Gensler likely resigns next year: 10x. Germany already lost $124m profit selling.
